Package domainLayer.blocks

Class BlockRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • domainLayer.blocks.BlockRepository
  • public class BlockRepository
extends java.lang.Object
    The BlockRepository performs Create, Update, Delete and Retrieve operations for Blocks.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    group17

    • Method Detail

      • addBlock

        public java.lang.String addBlock​(BlockType blockType,
                                 java.lang.String connectedBlockId,
                                 ConnectionType connection)
        Add a block of the given blockType to the domain and connect it with the given connectedBlockId on the given connection
        Parameters:
        blockType - The type of block to be added, this parameter is required.
        connectedBlockId - The ID of the block to connect to, can be empty.
        connection - The connection of the connected block on which the new block must be connected. If no connectedBlockId was given, this parameter must be set to "ConnectionType.NOCONNECTION".
        Returns:
        The ID of the block that has been added.
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockConnectionException - The given combination of the blockType,connectedBlockId and connection is impossible. - an ExecutableBlock added to an AssessableBlock or ControlBlock as condition - an AssessableBlock added to a block as a body or "next block" - a block added to another block of which the required connection is not provided. - a block added to a connection of a connected block to which there is already a block connected.
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - Is thrown when a connectedBlockId is given that is not present in the domain.

        public Block getBlockByID​(java.lang.String ID)
        Retrieve a block by its ID
        Parameters:
        ID -
        Returns:
        The block corresponding with the given ID. If there is no block for the given ID, null is returned.

      • removeBlock

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> removeBlock​(java.lang.String blockId,
                                                   java.lang.Boolean isChain)
        Remove a block by its ID
        Parameters:
        isChain - A flag announcing if a chain of blocks has to be removed or if only the given blockId has to be removed.
        block - The ID of the block to be removed.
        Returns:
        A set containing the id's of all the blocks that were removed from the domain.
        Throws:
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - If the given BlockID doesn't result in a block in the domain.

      • moveBlock

        public java.lang.String moveBlock​(java.lang.String topOfMovedChainBlockId,
                                  java.lang.String movedBlockId,
                                  java.lang.String connectedAfterMoveBlockId,
                                  ConnectionType connectionAfterMove)
        Move a block given by it's ID in the domain, disconnecting it from an eventual connected block to connect it to another block.
        Parameters:
        movedBlockId - The Id of block to be moved, this parameter is required.
        connectedAfterMoveBlockId - The Id of the block you wish to connect the block you are moving to. This parameter is Required. If there's no connected block after the move please use an empty String, "".
        connectionAfterMove - The connection of the block you wish to connect the block you are moving to. This parameter is Required. If there's no connected block after the move please use ConnectionType.NOCONNECTION.
        Returns:
        This method will return an Set of Strings that corresponds to the block that have been modified while moving a block. If you move a block that has no connected block underneath the only block being modified is the block you've moved. In this case you'll receive a set with only the Id of the block you've moved. Otherwise if the block you are moving has blocks underneath and thus forms a chain of block. Moving this chain of block upon on other block will have as result that the last block of the chain will be connected to the block you wished to connect your chain of blocks to. This method will then return a set with the head of the chain, the actual block you selected to move, and the last block of the chain, due to modification towards the block underneath it.
        Throws:
        NoSuchConnectedBlockException - If This Exception is thrown all modifications will not occur. By this principle if you wished to move a block, consider this block still being at it's "old" place/connection. This exception will be thrown in following cases; - If the Id of the moved block does not exist in the domain. - If one of the connected block id's is not existing in the domain.
        InvalidBlockConnectionException - If this Exception is thrown all modifications will not occur. By this principle if you wished to move a block, consider this block still being at it's "old" place/connection. This exception will be thrown in following cases; For simplicity we will use the examples of BlockA and BlockB. - If you wish to disconnect BlockA of BlockB by moving BlockA but BlockB has no connection with BlockA. - If you wish to disconnect BlockA of BlockB given an certain ConnectionType, but BlockB has no connection with BlockA on this particular ConnectionType. - If a BlockA is dropped on the ConnectionType UP of BlockB but the socket of BlockB is not aviable.

      • getConnectedBlockBeforeMove

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getConnectedBlockBeforeMove​(java.lang.String movedBlockId,
                                                                         java.lang.String afmId,
                                                                         ConnectionType cafm)
        Returns the connected block before a move that isn't connected anymore after the move.
        Parameters:
        movedBlockId - The id of the block to be moved
        afmId - The id of the block on which a new connection will be made
        cafm - The new connection
        Returns:
        An arrayList with on position 0 the old connection and on position 1 the old ID. If there is no connected block that isn't connected anymore NOCONNECTION will be returned on position 0 and an empty string on position 1.

      • checkIfValidProgram

        public boolean checkIfValidProgram()
        Checks whether a the programArea is in a valid state or not.
        Returns:
        True if following points are respected; - All blocks in program area are connected together. This means that their is only one "Head Block". - If all "Control Block"-types are in a valid state, which implies that they have a condition and at least one block connected to the BODY ConnectionType. - If a "Control Block" has a operand or chain of operands, this block/chain must be connected with a "Condition Block"

        Parameters:
        block - the block to check if it's valid
        Returns:
        a flag indicating if a chain of operand finishes with a conditionBlock.

      • getAllBlockIDsUnderneath

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllBlockIDsUnderneath​(Block block)
        Returns all the BlockID's underneath a certain block
        Parameters:
        block - The blockID of the Block of which you want to retrieve all Blocks underneath.
        Returns:
        A set containing the blockID's of all connected Conditions and every kind of block in the body of the given block or under the given block. The ID of the block itself is also given.

      • getAllBlockIDsInBody

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllBlockIDsInBody​(ControlBlock controlBlock)
        Returns all the blockID's in the body of a given ControlBlock
        Parameters:
        controlBlock - The controlBlock of which you want to retrieve all Blocks in the body.
        Returns:
        A set containing the blockID of the blocks in the body of the given ControlBlock, there won't be any ID's of assessable blocks.
